Question
========
  
Researcher A and B both expect an effect size of .50. Researcher A uses a $\alpha$ of 5%, and researcher B uses a $\alpha$ of 10% (both two-sided). Which researcher needs a larger sample if both are to achieve a power of .70?

  
Answerlist
----------
* Researcher A
* Researcher B
* If both tests expect a similar effect size, they need an equally large sample size needed.
* Because $\beta$ for both is .30, they need an equally large sample size.
